text: Anthony James "Tony O" Esposito (April 23, 1943 â€“ August 10, 2021) was a professional ice hockey goaltender, who played in the National Hockey League. He was most known for playing for the hockey team Chicago Black Hawks. He was considered one of the pioneers of the now popular butterfly style. He was put into the Hockey Hall of Fame in 1988. He was born in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario. Esposito died on August 10, 2021 at the age of 78, from pancreatic cancer. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1943 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American ice hockey goaltenders Category:Calder Trophy winners Category:Canadian ice hockey goaltenders Category:Central Professional Hockey League players Category:Chicago Blackhawks players Category:Deaths from pancreatic cancer Category:Hockey Hall of Fame inductees Category:Ice hockey people from Ontario Category:Montreal Canadiens players Category:People from Sault Ste. title: Tony Esposito
